intro: Teucrium libanitis, commonly known as Lebanon germander, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy choice for rocky or dry garden environments. Teucrium libanitis is also valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
